intro: Maytenus angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its slender, often twisted branches and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils and along forest edges. Maytenus angustifolia is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
